text:
Authorities have banned celebratory firing in Shamli district of Uttar Pradesh where an eight-year-old boy had died after being shot by Samajwadi Party workers celebrating panchayat poll results.

Shamli Circle Officer Nishank Sharma informed owners of banquet halls of the ban. Strict action would be taken against those violating it, he added.

The eight-year-old was killed during celebratory firing by Samajwadi Party workers at Kairana town in Shamli on February 7, triggering protests by locals.

The victim, Sami, who was passing by the area in a rickshaw, was hit during the firing by SP workers who were celebrating the victory of party candidate Nafisa in the local body polls.

The SHO of Kairana town has been suspended and the Circle Officer there has been shifted. — PTI
title: Celebratory firing banned in Shamli district
